title: Sensex down 100 pts, Nifty below 25,200 as PSU banks, IT stocks fall
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex gave up early gains to trade lower in the afternoon, dragged down by sharp losses in PSU bank and IT stocks. Sentiment remained fragile as investors weighed weak Q1 earnings signals and global tariff concerns, keeping markets under pressure. At about 12:45 pm, the Sensex was down 114.47 points or 0.14 percent at 82,520.01, and the Nifty was down 23.45 points or 0.09 percent at 25,188.60. About 1857 shares advanced, 1549 shares declined, and 139 shares remained unchanged. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Experts say investors are walking a tightrope between optimism and caution amid the ongoing relief rally, with focus firmly on Q1FY26 corporate earnings. Given stretched valuations, strong earnings upgrades will be key to sustaining the momentum. At the same time, global sentiment remains fragile, clouded by persistent tariff concerns. Sectoral performance on the NSE was mixed, with defensive and consumption-related indices leading the gains. Nifty Realty outperformed with a 1.12 percent rise, followed by Pharma, which added 0.67 percent, and FMCG, up 0.55 percent. Consumer Durables and Energy also saw modest gains. On the flip side, selling pressure was visible in rate-sensitive sectors, with IT slipping 0.84 percent and PSU Banks down 0.75 percent. Private Banks, the Nifty Bank, and Infrastructure indices also ended in the red. Broader markets were largely flat, with the Nifty Midcap 100 down 0.15 percent and the Smallcap 100 easing 0.02 percent. Volatility remained subdued as the India VIX dipped 0.27 percent to 11.21. Also read: Tax breaks may bring back urban consumption but not without better wages Among individual stocks, Le Travenues Tech, the operator of online travel portal Ixigo, were higher by 14 percent to trade at all-time highs after the June quarter results showed strong growth, led by faster-than-expected growth in bus and flight bookings with a Gross Transaction Value (GTV) growth of 55 percent on year. Information and technology player Tech Mahindra Ltd (TechM) shares fell by over 2 percent after the Mahindra Group company posted its earnings results for the three months ended June 30, 2025. Brokerages remained mixed on their outlook for the firm following strong deal wins during the quarter, while the revenue came in under estimates. The shares of Sona BLW Precision Forgings sharply surged over 8 percent on July 17 after a report said that Chinese automaker BYD is in talks with the company for the supply of EV components. The Indian company may also set up a local component manufacturing plant in China, CNBC-TV18 reported. Talks between Sona BLW and BYD have been ongoing for the past few months now, and the local component manufacturing plant in China is part of Sona BLW's long term roadmap. Read more: Dialysis chain NephroPlus to file papers for Rs 2,000-cr IPO this month "For sustained upward movement, Nifty must hold above 25,330. Upside resistance is seen at 25,600–25,700, while 25,000 acts as immediate support. Bank Nifty continues its bullish structure of higher highs and higher lows after a successful double bottom pattern. Strong volumes suggest buying interest. The index must stay above 57,200 to retain bullish sentiment. A breakout above 57,600–58,000 can trigger sharp upside, whereas 56,800 is key support on the downside," Mandar Bhojane of Choice Equity Broking said. Tata Consumer Products, Hindalco, Trent, Tata Motors, and Sun Pharma were the top gainers on the Nifty. Laggards on the index were Tech Mahindra, IndusInd Bank, L&T, Infosys, and SBI Life Insurance. title: Union Bank, Bank of India, Canara Bank, other PSU bank stocks drop up to 2% on profit booking
content: The shares of PSU banks dropped in red on July 17 as investors may have resorted to profit booking at elevated levels. The sharp fall in the share prices pushed the Nifty PSU Bank index down half a percent to stand in the red. The PSU Bank index has now snapped a three-day gaining streak, which was buoyed by multiple factors. Union Bank of India was the top loser on the index, dropping nearly 2 percent to trade at Rs 146 apiece. Bank of India shares followed, falling over 1.5 percent. Canara Bank and Punjab National Bank (PNB) shares dropped over 1 percent each, while Bank of Baroda, Punjab & Sind Bank and Indian Bank shares were down nearly a percent. UCO Bank shares were meanwhile trading in the red with marginal losses. Shares of Central Bank of India, Indian Overseas Bank (IOB), State Bank of India (SBI) and Bank of Maharashtra however bucked the trend to trade in the green with marginal gains. Also read: SBI's Rs 25,000-crore QIP over-subscribed 3x on solid demand led by LIC The stocks have recently surged after reports suggested that the Centre might look towards a fresh round of reforms for the financial sector. According to CNBC-TV18, sources stated that additional consolidation among public lenders remains a possibility, as the government looks to create larger banking institutions capable of supporting the credit demands of a rapidly expanding economy. Further, there is also a proposal which is under consideration to raise the current 20 percent limit on foreign ownership in PSU banks. This move will help to draw long-term investors towards the banks, while also broadening the capital base of these lenders. Additionally, the sources suggested that the Centre may also allow large corporates into the banking space, with the additional of guardrails and strong frameworks, along with RBI's oversight. Some of these safeguards could be adding a limit to corporate shareholding in banks, or making sure that the bank's capital is not use to self-fund the corporate, or allowing large NBFCs to upgrade to commercial banks. title: Sona BLW in talks to set up EV component unit in China, supply parts to BYD, reports CNBC-TV18; shares jump 7%
content: The shares of Sona BLW Precision Forgings sharply surged nearly 7 percent on July 17 after a report said that Chinese automaker BYD is in talks with the company for the supply of EV components. The Indian company may also set up a local component manufacturing plant in China, CNBC-TV18 reported. Talks between Sona BLW and BYD have been ongoing for the past few months now, and the local component manufacturing plant in China is part of Sona BLW's long term roadmap for collaboration with BYD, the report added citing people familiar with the matter. Moneycontrol couldn't independently verify the report. After the news report was published, exchanges sought clarification from Sona BLW following the strong surge in share price. "In this regard, the Company wish to clarify that the Company is in discussions with several potential customers in India and globally in the ordinary course, for growth of its business," the company said. Notably, Sona BLW derives a major portion of their revenue by providing EV components to BYD's rival – Elon Musk's Tesla. The sharp rise in the share price was backed by a rise in trading volumes. More than 1.26 crore shares of the company have been involved in active trade today so far, as seen at 12.10 pm. This is nearly 5 times higher than its 10-day average volumes. Sona BLW Precision Forgings shares were trading at Rs 488 apiece in the afternoon. The stock has gained nearly 8 percent in the past five days, and around 2 percent in the past one month. The stock however has plunged more than 15 percent in the past six months, and is down nearly 18 percent in 2025 so far. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Notably, the stock has seen significant volatility in 2025 so far, amid US President Donald Trump's flip flops. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. title: Hitachi Energy India shares surge nearly 4% amid high volume
content: Shares of Hitachi Energy India gained nearly 4% to trade at Rs 19,235.00 in Thursday's session, witnessing high volume. The stock is part of the NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index. On the financial front, Hitachi Energy India's standalone annual income statement shows consistent growth. Sales for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 6,384 Crore, up from Rs 5,237 Crore in March 2024. Other income also increased to Rs 57 Crore in March 2025 compared to Rs 9 Crore in March 2024. Total income reached Rs 6,442 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 5,246 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. Total expenditure increased from Rs 4,978 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 5,880 Crore in March 2025. The company reported an EBIT of Rs 561 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, up from Rs 268 Crore in March 2024. Net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 383 Crore, compared to Rs 163 Crore in March 2024. The standalone quarterly income statement reveals sales of Rs 1,883 Crore for March 2025, compared to Rs 1,695 Crore for March 2024. Other income stood at Rs 38 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025, while it was Rs 52 Crore in December 2024. The company's EBIT for the quarter-ending March 2025 was Rs 252 Crore, while net profit for the same period was Rs 183 Crore. Hitachi Energy India’s balance sheet highlights that its share capital has remained constant at Rs 8 Crore over the past five years. Reserves and surplus increased from Rs 1,351 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 4,205 Crore in March 2025. Total liabilities rose to Rs 8,613 Crore in March 2025, up from Rs 4,707 Crore in March 2024. Total assets also increased to Rs 8,613 Crore as of March 2025, compared to Rs 4,707 Crore in the previous year. Cash flow from operating activities increased significantly to Rs 1,493 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 252 Crore in March 2024. The company's net cash flow stood at Rs 3,678 Crore in March 2025, compared to a negative cash flow of Rs -35 Crore in March 2024. Key financial ratios for Hitachi Energy India show a basic EPS of Rs 90.36 and diluted EPS of Rs 90.36 for the year-ending March 2025. The book value per share was Rs 944.87 as of March 2025. The company's dividend per share was Rs 6.00 for the year-ending March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. Hitachi Energy India announced a final dividend of Rs 6.00 per share, with the effective date being August 13, 2025. Prior to this, the company had announced a final dividend of Rs 4.00 per share, effective from August 14, 2024. As of 11:47 am, Hitachi Energy India shares traded at Rs 19,235.00, with high volume, marking a 3.64% increase.

title: Hold Larsen and Toubro Technology Services; target of Rs 4250: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Larsen and Toubro Technology Services The revenue growth (-4.2% QoQ CC) was below our estimates (-2.5% QoQ CC), attributed to the SWC seasonality, however ex-India USD revenue grew by 1.5% QoQ. The mobility business (ex-Auto) has stabilized and picked up pace in the off-highway and trucks segments, while Automotive sees incremental pauses and deferrals on executions. The weakness in the Automotive is fairly balanced against the momentum within Sustainability, validated through securing $50m deal within the space. The deal ramp up would support the growth in H2, and even beyond the sizable win ($200m+ LD TCV) the deal pipeline seems to be robust. Given the revenue miss in Q1, the ask-rare translates to ~2.8% CQGR for the rest of the year to achieve low double-digit CC growth. We believe the large deal ramp up and positive SWC seasonality would support growth in H2 to achieve directional milestone. Margins were largely stable despite the notable revenue decline, partly aided by low-margin SWC seasonality and continued momentum in high-margin Sustainability business. We are adjusting our revenue growth against Q1 miss, while keeping our margin estimates largely unchanged. We are building in 9.8%/9.2% CC revenue growth, while keeping EBIT margins unchanged at 13.9%/14.7% for FY26E/FY27E. Outlook We are assigning 29x PE to FY27E EPS, translating a TP of 4,250. Valuations capped with no potential upside, maintain our HOLD rating. title: Le Travenues, operator of ixigo, clocks faster-than-expected growth riding on Gen Z bookings, shares soar 14 percent
content: Shares of Le Travenues Tech, the operator of online travel portal Ixigo were higher by 14 percent to trade at all-time highs after the June quarter results showed strong growth, led by faster-than-expected growth in bus and flight bookings with a Gross Transaction Value (GTV) growth of 55% on year. Le Travenues' June quarter revenue rose by 73% on year to Rs 314 crore, while the net profit rose by 27.7% YoY to Rs 18.9 crore. The Gross Transaction Value (GTV) rose to Rs 4,644.66 crore in Q1FY26, growing by 55% YoY. Flight and Bus GTV each grew 81% YoY, and Train GTV rose by 30% YoY for Q1FY26, underpinned by strong domestic travel demand. The Gross Transaction Value (GTV) has clocked a CAGR of 83.7% over the last six years. The management is confident of sustaining a GTV growth of over 40 percent for the full year. "...we still have significant headroom for growth. But as we scale and category penetration deepens, it’s natural that our growth rates will gradually moderate and align more closely with the long-term category growth rates in our industry. Our job is to extend this phase of outperformance as long as possible," Saurabh Devendra Singh, Group CFO, ixigo said. The bus and train segments at ixigo continue to gain traction, with train bookings by Gen Z travellers (aged 18-30) rising 45% YoY on the portal, led by Mumbai, Delhi, Kolkata, Visakhapatnam and Pune as the fastest-growing markets. Bus bookings by Gen Z saw an even sharper growth, rising 56% YoY, the company filing said. CEO and MD Aloke Bajpai said over the next few years, he is confident of grow 'significantly faster than the market' in segments like Hotels, Buses and Flights, and "in line with the online market’s growth in Trains". The company's train booking market share has now grown to more than 60 percent. The strong growth has come during a quarter that had seen disruption in flights and airspace closures due to Op Sindoor. The management admitted temporary airspace closures across North India in May was significant, but the post-event recovery has been 'swift', adding that the ecosystem has adapted quickly. ixigo's Director Rajnish Kumar said he is confident of stronger growth in flight business. "Penetration of air travel in India is still in its early innings compared to global benchmarks, and we see headroom for growth, particularly from regional airports and underserved segments. Just over 4% of Indians travel on flights, compared to 37%+ in China and 85%+ in the US and once the GDP per capita crosses the $400 mark in India we expect discretionary to flow further in flight and hotel categories," Kumar said. India’s airport infrastructure, poised for an expansion, will see the number of operational airports double in ten years to over 160 in 2025. "The government is targeting 200 airports by next year, and 240 airports by 2030, through a Rs 92,000 crore investment push," the CFO said, highlighting it as a tailwind for the company.

title: Reduce Tech Mahindra; target of Rs 1600: Emkay Global Financial
content: Emkay Global Financial' research report on Tech Mahindra TechM’s 1Q operating performance was slightly below expectations. Revenue grew 1.0% QoQ to USD1.56bn (down 1.4% CC), marginally missing estimates. With EBITM expanding by 60bps QoQ to 11.1%, TechM logged the 7th quarter of margin expansion, on disciplined execution and benefits accruing from Project Fortius, albeit a tad lower than estimated. Deal intake stayed strong for a 3rd straight quarter, with TCV of USD809mn driving 44% growth in deal intake on TTM basis. Revenue conversion was hit by a challenging macro environment, right-sizing field service business, reduced spending in Auto, and certain client run-offs leading to a slower start in FY26. However, the mgmt expects growth to improve Q2 onward, and certainly from H2, backed by deal wins and pipeline. The mgmt reiterated its 15% EBITM target for FY27, albeit suggesting risk from the prolonged period of an uncertain and tough macro environment. Outlook We cut FY26E-28E EPS by 2.4%-0.1%, factoring in the Q1 performance. Given the rich valuations, we retain REDUCE on TechM with TP of Rs 1,600 at 20x Jun-27E EPS. title: Neutral Larsen and Toubro Technology; target of Rs 4300: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Larsen and Toubro Technology L&T Technology’s (LTTS) 1QFY26 revenue declined 2.8% QoQ in USD terms vs. our estimate of ~1.1% QoQ decline. In CC terms, revenue was down 4.2% QoQ. Sustainability grew 4.1% QoQ, while Hi-Tech/Mobility was down 8.5%/1.5% QoQ. EBIT margin stood at 13.3% vs. our estimate of 12.8%. Adj. PAT stood at INR3.1b (est. INR3.0b), up 1.5% QoQ/1.0% YoY. For 1QFY26, revenue/EBIT declined 3.9%/1.0%, while PAT grew 1% YoY in INR terms. We expect revenue/EBIT to grow 2.5%/1.6%, while PAT to remain flat YoY in 2QFY26. Outlook We reiterate our Neutral rating on the stock with a revised TP of INR4,300 (based on 27x FY27E EPS). For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Larsen and Toubro Technology - 17072025 - moti

The company fixed July 12, 2025, as the record date for determining entitlement of members to the final dividend for the financial year ended March 31, 2025. If the final dividend recommended by the Board of Directors is approved at the AGM, payment will be made after July 26, 2025, subject to tax deduction. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 4.00 per share (200%) on May 23, 2025, with an effective date of July 11, 2025. Prior to this, interim dividends were announced on January 22, 2025, October 21, 2024, and August 2, 2024, each at Rs 4.00 per share. The company has also issued bonus shares in the past, with the most recent bonus issue on November 8, 2017, in the ratio of 1:1. A stock split was announced on October 30, 2010, with the old face value of Rs 10 split into a new face value of Rs 2, effective December 20, 2010. Moneycontrol's sentiment analysis indicates a bullish outlook for the stock as of July 17, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 2,770.60, Balkrishna Industries has shown strong positive movement in today's session, driven by high volume and favorable investor sentiment.

title: AWL Agri, Thermax among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: In Thursday's trading session, several stocks demonstrated notable gains within the Nifty Midcap 150 index. At 10:30 am this hour, AWL Agri led the gains with an hourly change of 6.16% at a price of Rs 278.50. Thermax followed with an hourly rise of 5.14%, trading at Rs 3,833.10. Sona BLW saw an hourly gain of 3.46%, reaching Rs 470.80, while Apollo Tyres increased by 3.17% to Rs 469.65. Hitachi Energy also showed a positive movement, rising by 3.13% to Rs 19,140.00. title: LT Technology Services shares surge 2.66% amid high volume
content: LT Technology Services shares experienced a surge of 2.66% in Thursday's trading session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 4,462.50. The stock is witnessing high volume in today's session. Quarterly Financial Highlights The company's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,866.00 Crore, compared to Rs 2,461.90 Crore in June 2024, marking a significant increase. Net profit for the same period was Rs 316.10 Crore, slightly up from Rs 313.90 Crore in the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) was reported as Rs 29.81, a marginal increase from Rs 29.65 in June 2024. Annual Financial Performance LT Technology Services has demonstrated substantial growth over the past five years. The consolidated annual revenue increased from Rs 5,449.70 Crore in 2021 to Rs 10,670.10 Crore in 2025. The company's net profit also saw a considerable rise, from Rs 666.50 Crore in 2021 to Rs 1,263.50 Crore in 2025. However, there was a slight dip in net profit compared to the Rs 1,306.30 Crore reported in 2024. Key Financial Metrics (Consolidated)YearRevenue (Rs. Crore)Net Profit (Rs. Crore)EPS (Rs.)BVPS (Rs.)ROE (%)Debt to Equity20215,449.70666.5063.32331.7319.090.0020226,569.70960.6090.92395.8522.990.0020238,013.601,174.10110.80470.9923.620.0020249,647.301,306.30123.34502.5624.470.00202510,670.101,263.50119.70573.5820.830.00The company's revenue has consistently grown, with a 9.4% increase from Rs 9,647.30 Crore in 2024 to Rs 10,670.10 Crore in 2025. However, net profit saw a slight decrease of 3.3% during the same period. EPS also experienced a minor decline, from Rs 123.34 in 2024 to Rs 119.70 in 2025. The company's book value per share (BVPS) has steadily increased, reaching Rs 573.58 in 2025. Return on Equity (ROE) stands at 20.83% for March 2025. The company has maintained a zero debt-to-equity ratio over the past five years. Cash Flow Statement The cash flow from operating activities has shown a positive trend, with Rs 1,481 Crore in 2025. Investing activities resulted in a cash outflow of Rs -509 Crore, while financing activities led to an outflow of Rs -718 Crore. The net cash flow for the year was Rs 253 Crore. Balance Sheet Highlights As of March 2025, LT Technology Services reported total assets of Rs 9,643 Crore, compared to Rs 8,488 Crore in the previous year. The company's reserves and surplus amounted to Rs 5,967 Crore. Current liabilities stood at Rs 2,990 Crore. Financial Ratios Key financial ratios for LT Technology Services as of March 2025 include a P/E ratio of 37.61, a P/B ratio of 7.85, and an EV/EBITDA of 21.96. The company's current ratio is 2.16, and it maintains a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00. Corporate Actions LT Technology Services announced several corporate actions, including the Q1 FY26 Earnings Conference Call Recording, Allotment of equity shares under the ESOP Scheme, and Investor Presentation, all announced on July 16, 2025. The company has announced a final dividend of Rs 38 per share (1900%) with effective date as June 6, 2025. LT Technology Services is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index.

title: Buy Tech Mahindra; target of Rs 2000: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Tech Mahindra Tech Mahindra (TECHM) reported 1QFY26 revenue of USD1.6b, down 1.4% QoQ in constant currency (CC) vs. our estimate of 1.0% cc decline. Communications/Manufacturing grew 2.8%/4.0% QoQ. BFS/Retail were down 0.6%/1.0% QoQ. EBIT margin was up 60bp QoQ at 11.1%, beating our estimate of 10.7%. PAT stood at INR11.4b (down 2.2% QoQ/up 33% YoY), below our estimate of INR12b. In INR terms, revenue/EBIT/PAT grew 2.7%/34.0%/34.0% YoY. In 2QFY26, we expect revenue/EBIT/PAT to grow by 3.9%/31.0%/9.1% YoY. Outlook We reiterate BUY on TECHM with a TP of INR2,000 (implying 24% upside), based on 25x FY27E EPS. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Tech Mahindra - 17072025 - moti

Key financial ratios for Kalyan Jewellers India show a P/E ratio of 69.95 and a P/B ratio of 10.09 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.20 as of the year-ending March 2025. Cash flow from operating activities for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 973 Crore. Moneycontrol's sentiment analysis, conducted on July 10, 2025, indicates a very bullish outlook for the stock.

title: KEI Industries shares rise 2.28% in morning trade
content: Shares of KEI Industries gained 2.28% to trade at Rs 3,980 in Thursday's session. The stock movement comes amid a Moneycontrol analysis indicating bearish sentiment as of July 11, 2025. Here's a summary of KEI Industries' recent financial performance: Consolidated Quarterly Financials: KEI Industries' consolidated quarterly revenue has shown a fluctuating trend over the last five quarters. The revenue for the quarter-ending March 2024 was Rs 2,319.28 Crore, which decreased to Rs 2,060.50 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. It then increased to Rs 2,279.65 Crore and Rs 2,467.27 Crore for the quarter-ending September 2024 and December 2024, respectively. The latest reported revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stands at Rs 2,914.79 Crore. Net profit also saw fluctuations, with Rs 168.48 Crore reported for March 2024, declining to Rs 150.25 Crore by June 2024, then recovering to Rs 154.81 Crore and Rs 164.81 Crore for September and December 2024, respectively. The net profit for the quarter-ending March 2025 was reported as Rs 226.55 Crore. EPS (Earnings Per Share) followed a similar trend, starting at Rs 18.67 in March 2024, dropping to Rs 16.65 by June 2024, and then rising to Rs 17.16 and Rs 17.87 for the subsequent quarters. title: Hexaware Tech shares rise 3% on deal to acquire SMC Square entities for Rs 1,029 crore
content: Shares of Hexaware Technologies rose 3 percent to Rs 882 in morning deals on July 17 after the compnay announced the acquisition of Tech SMC Square India and Tech SMCSquared (GCC) India in a deal valued at up to Rs 1,029 crore, marking a significant step in its strategy to scale up in the rapidly expanding Global Capability Center (GCC) space. The transaction, which is structured entirely in cash, includes an upfront payout of $45 million, with the remainder linked to performance-based earnouts. The deal is expected to close on July 17, 2025. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates This acquisition allows Hexaware to deepen its footprint in the mid-market GCC segment—an area witnessing exponential growth in India and projected to cross $100 billion by 2030. With a team of around 500 employees and delivery centers in Bengaluru and Hyderabad, SMC Square brings with it strong execution capabilities and a go-to-market presence in the US. The deal gives Hexaware immediate access to SMC’s proven expertise in GCC setup and operations, while also allowing it to integrate those offerings with its strengths in AI, cloud, analytics, and enterprise platforms. Also read: Smartworks Coworking Spaces shares list at 7% premium over IPO price on NSE; should you buy, sell or hold? By combining, Hexaware is aiming to provide end-to-end transformation solutions for companies looking to scale and optimise their GCC operations. The acquisition also enhances Hexaware’s ability to attract high-quality tech talent and reinforces its position in the evolving technology services landscape. Shares of Hexaware Technologies closed 1.39 percent higher on Wednesday at ₹858 and are up 13 percent so far this year. At about 10 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs 866, higher by 1 percent from the last close on the NSE. Hexaware Tech shares have risen 30 percent in the last three months. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Hindalco, SBI stocks among top gainers on Nifty 50

Prod shares are trading at Rs 1,088.00, a gain of 0.6% in today's session. Apollo Hospital shares are trading at Rs 7,394.00, a gain of 0.56% in today's session. The company also announced Scrunitizer's Report for Postal ballot dated June 27, 2025 and Outcome of Postal Ballot dated June 27, 2025 on June 28, 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 3.50 per share (350%) on May 24, 2024, with an effective date of August 09, 2024. The company issued bonus shares on multiple occasions, including a 1:2 bonus ratio on September 02, 1996. The company had rights issues, including a 3:7 rights ratio on August 28, 2008, with a face value of Rs 1 and a premium of Rs 95. The company split its shares on August 30, 2005, changing the face value from Rs 10 to Rs 1. SBI: SBI announced Committe Meeting Update on QIP on July 16, 2025. The company also announced outcome of board meeting held on July 16, 2025 regarding Fund Raising by issue of Basel III compliant Additional Tier 1 and Tier 2 Bonds on July 16, 2025. SBI announced a final dividend of Rs 15.90 per share (1590%) on May 05, 2025, with an effective date of May 16, 2025. The company had rights issues, including a 1:5 rights ratio on January 28, 2008, with a face value of Rs 10 and a premium of Rs 1580. The company split its shares on November 20, 2014, changing the face value from Rs 10 to Rs 1. TATA Cons. Prod: TATA Cons. Prod announced Intimation of schedule of Conference Call pertaining to Financial Results and Board Meeting Intimation For Financial Results For The Quarter Ended June 30, 2025 on July 16, 2025. The company also announced Certificate under Reg 74 (5) of SEBI (DP) Regulation, 2018 on July 03, 2025. TATA Cons. Prod announced a final dividend of Rs 8.25 per share (825%) on April 23, 2025, with an effective date of May 29, 2025. The company issued bonus shares on multiple occasions, including a 1:2 bonus ratio on October 07, 1994. The company had rights issues, including a 1:26 rights ratio on July 26, 2024, with a face value of Rs 1 and a premium of Rs 817. The company split its shares on June 30, 2010, changing the face value from Rs 10 to Rs 1. Apollo Hospital: Apollo Hospital announced Certificate under Regulation 74(5) for the period ended 30th June 2025 and Announcement under Regulation 30 (LODR)-Analyst / Investor Meet - Outcome on July 08, 2025. Apollo Hospital announced an interim dividend of Rs 9.00 per share (180%) on February 10, 2025, with an effective date of February 14, 2025. The company had rights issues, including a 1:1 rights ratio on March 10, 1993, with a premium of Rs 10. The company split its shares on September 02, 2010, changing the face value from Rs 10 to Rs 5. UltraTechCement: UltraTechCement announced Certificate under Reg 74(5) of SEBI (DP) Regulations on July 15, 2025. The company also announced Intimation Regarding - Special Window - Re-Lodgement For Transfer Of Physical Shares on July 12, 2025 and Resignation of senior management personnel on July 04, 2025. UltraTechCement announced a final dividend of Rs 70.00 per share (700%) on April 29, 2024, with an effective date of July 30, 2024. Disclaimer: This analysis is purely based on the data provided , and Moneycontrol does not provide any recommendations.

title: Infosys shares decline 0.73%; stock among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Infosys were trading lower at Rs 1,596.20, a 0.73% decrease from the previous close, with the stock featuring among the top losers on the Nifty 50 index. At 10:10 am, the stock reflected a bearish sentiment in the market. Financial Snapshot: The following tables provide a summary of Infosys's financial performance. Quarterly Results (Consolidated):HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 37,923.00 CroreRs 39,315.00 CroreRs 40,986.00 CroreRs 41,764.00 CroreRs 40,925.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 7,975.00 CroreRs 6,374.00 CroreRs 6,516.00 CroreRs 6,822.00 CroreRs 7,038.00 CroreEPS19.2515.3815.7116.4316.98The revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 40,925.00 Crore, while the revenue for the quarter-ending March 2024 was Rs 37,923.00 Crore. title: Buy JSW Steel; target of Rs 1180: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on JSW Steel JSTL is investing INR600b over the next three years to enhance steelmaking and downstream capacities, operational efficiency, and raw material resources. By Sep’27, Phase-I expansion will increase JSTL’s domestic crude steel capacity by 17% to 41.9mtpa. This phase includes major projects like Vijayanagar, BPSL and Dolvi. As of now, the 5mtpa JVML expansion has been completed, taking its total India capacity to 34mtpa. Further, a 7mtpa expansion is underway (2mtpa Vijayanagar + 5mpta Dolvi) and is targeted to be commissioned by Sep’27. Several debottlenecking projects are also planned (BPSL 0.5mtpa + Salem 0.2mtpa), which will altogether increase the capacity to 42mtpa by Sep’27. Additionally, Phase-II expansion (awaiting board approval) could increase the company’s total domestic capacity to 50mtpa by FY31. Outlook At CMP, JSTL trades at 7.6x FY27E EV/EBITDA. We reiterate our BUY rating on the stock with a TP of INR1,180 (premised on 8.5x EV/EBITDA on FY27 estimate). For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. JSW Steel - 17072025 - moti

title: Tata Consultancy Services shares gain 0.26% in early trade
content: Tata Consultancy Services shares are trading at Rs 3,241.40, up 0.26% in Thursday's early session. The stock is showing marginal positive movement in today's trade, with respect to the previous close, and is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. Tata Consultancy Services, a Nifty 50 constituent, has demonstrated consistent financial performance. The consolidated annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 255,324 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 240,893 Crore in the previous year. Net profit for the same period was Rs 48,797 Crore, up from Rs 46,099 Crore in the previous year. The company's earnings per share (EPS) also increased from Rs 125.88 in March 2024 to Rs 134.19 in March 2025. Here is a detailed look at the company's financial performance:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)2021164,17732,56286.712022191,75438,449103.622023225,45842,303115.192024240,89346,099125.882025255,32448,797134.19The company has shown steady growth in its key financial metrics over the past five years. The annual sales increased from Rs 164,177 Crore in 2021 to Rs 255,324 Crore in 2025. Other income also saw an increase, with a total income of Rs 259,286 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 167,311 Crore in March 2021. Total expenditure rose from Rs 122,914 Crore to Rs 193,159 Crore over the same period, resulting in an EBIT increase from Rs 44,397 Crore to Rs 66,127 Crore. The net profit climbed from Rs 32,562 Crore in 2021 to Rs 48,797 Crore in 2025. Tata Consultancy Services’ consolidated quarterly revenue has also remained robust. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was reported at Rs 63,437 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 64,479 Crore reported for the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the June 2025 quarter stood at Rs 12,819 Crore, compared to Rs 12,293 Crore in the previous quarter. The EPS for the same period was Rs 35.27, up from Rs 33.79 in the previous quarter.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 202462,61312,10533.28Sep 202464,25911,95532.92Dec 202463,97312,44434.21Mar 202564,47912,29333.79Jun 202563,43712,81935.27The company’s balance sheet for the year-ending March 2025 shows a share capital of Rs 362 Crore and reserves & surplus of Rs 94,394 Crore. The total liabilities amount to Rs 159,629 Crore, with current liabilities at Rs 53,001 Crore. On the assets side, fixed assets are valued at Rs 22,739 Crore, and current assets at Rs 123,012 Crore. Key financial ratios for Tata Consultancy Services as of March 2025 include a basic EPS of Rs 134.19, a book value per share of Rs 261.76, and a dividend per share of Rs 126. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 and an interest coverage ratio of 89.66. Tata Consultancy Services has announced several dividends, including an interim dividend of Rs 11.00 per share (1100%) with an effective date of July 16, 2025. Other recent dividends include a final dividend of Rs 30.00 per share (3000%) effective June 4, 2025, and a special dividend of Rs 66.00 per share (6600%) effective January 17, 2025. Tata Consultancy Services had also issued bonus shares in the ratio of 1:1 on three occasions, with the most recent being announced on April 19, 2018, and the ex-bonus date was May 31, 2018. With the stock currently trading at Rs 3,241.40, Tata Consultancy Services is showing a slightly positive trend in today's early session.

title: Sona BLW Precision Forgings shares rise 2.07% in morning trade
content: Shares of Sona BLW Precision Forgings gained 2.07% in Thursday's early trading session. The stock is currently trading at Rs 464.45. The stock is among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150. Sona BLW Precision Forgings' revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 864.75 Crore. In comparison, the revenue for the quarter-ending March 2024 was Rs 885.27 Crore. The net profit for the quarter-ending March 2025 was Rs 163.69 Crore, while in the quarter-ending March 2024, the net profit was Rs 148.08 Crore. The company reported an EPS of Rs 2.64 for the quarter-ending March 2025, compared to an EPS of Rs 2.54 in the quarter-ending March 2024. The consolidated annual revenue for Sona BLW Precision Forgings in 2025 was Rs 3,546.02 Crore, a rise compared to Rs 3,184.77 Crore in 2024. The net profit for 2025 was Rs 599.69 Crore, up from Rs 517.78 Crore in 2024. The EPS for 2025 stood at Rs 9.92, compared to Rs 8.83 in the previous year. Book Value Per Share (BVPS) increased significantly from Rs 47.75 in 2024 to Rs 88.38 in 2025. The company's Return on Equity (ROE) was 10.94% in 2025. Key financial ratios for Sona BLW Precision Forgings show a P/E ratio of 48.19 and a P/B ratio of 5.31 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. title: AWL Agri, Thermax stocks among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: In Thursday's trading session, several stocks demonstrated significant gains, with AWL Agri and Thermax leading the pack among Nifty Midcap 150 constituents. At 10:00 am, AWL Agri was trading at Rs 279.60, up 6.58%, while Thermax was at Rs 3,809.40, a gain of 4.49%. Other notable gainers included Apollo Tyres and Blue Star, showcasing positive momentum in the midcap segment.AWL Agri Financial OverviewAWL Agri's financial performance reveals a strong growth trajectory. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 63,672.24 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 51,261.63 Crore in 2024. Net profit also saw a substantial rise, reaching Rs 1,163.23 Crore in 2025 compared to Rs 170.65 Crore in the previous year. The company's earnings per share (EPS) increased to Rs 9.44 in 2025 from Rs 1.14 in 2024. title: Hindustan Unilever share price falls marginally in early trade
content: Shares of Hindustan Unilever were trading at Rs 2,511.90 on the NSE, down 0.23% in Thursday's session. The stock price experienced a slight dip in the early trading session. The stock is part of the Nifty 50 index. On the financial front, Hindustan Unilever has demonstrated consistent growth. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 63,121 Crore, showing an increase compared to Rs 61,896 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the same period was Rs 10,679 Crore, up from Rs 10,286 Crore in the previous year. The company's earnings per share (EPS) also increased from Rs 43.74 to Rs 45.32. Here is a summary of Hindustan Unilever's key financial data:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)202147,028.008,000.0034.03202252,446.008,887.0037.79202360,580.0010,145.0043.07202461,896.0010,286.0043.74202563,121.0010,679.0045.32The company’s quarterly performance also reflects steady financials. For the quarter-ending March 2025, the revenue stood at Rs 15,670 Crore and net profit was Rs 2,476 Crore. The EPS for the same period was Rs 10.48. Quarterly Financials:QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Mar 202415,210.002,561.0010.89Jun 202415,707.002,614.0011.11Sep 202415,926.002,601.0011.03Dec 202415,818.002,988.0012.70Mar 202515,670.002,476.0010.48Hindustan Unilever's balance sheet shows that as of March 2025, the company has a share capital of Rs 235 Crore and reserves & surplus of Rs 49,167 Crore. The total assets amount to Rs 79,880 Crore, including fixed assets of Rs 37,878 Crore and current assets of Rs 22,051 Crore. In terms of key ratios, the company’s basic EPS stood at Rs 45.32 for March 2025. The company had a dividend payout of Rs 53 per share. The debt to equity ratio is 0.00, and the current ratio is 1.33 as of March 2025. The company has announced a board meeting scheduled on July 31, 2025, to consider and approve the unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. Hindustan Unilever announced a final dividend of Rs 24 per share, with an effective date of June 23, 2025. The stock has a history of bonus issues, with the latest being announced on September 30, 1991, with a bonus ratio of 1:2 and an ex-bonus date of July 19, 1991. The company also had a stock split on July 3, 2000, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 1. Hindustan Unilever is currently trading with a marginal decrease from its previous close.

title: Sensex, Nifty open marginally lower amid mixed global cues; pharma, metal stocks gain
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex opened in the red on July 17, as investors remained cautious despite a strong close on Wall Street. Mixed cues from Asian markets and lingering worries over weak Q1 earnings and tariff uncertainties kept sentiment under pressure. At about 9:40 am, the Sensex was down 69.33 points or 0.08 percent at 82,565.15, and the Nifty was down 22.70 points or 0.09 percent at 25,189.35. About 1841 shares advanced, 1053 shares declined, and 175 shares remained unchanged. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Investors are treading a fine line between optimism and caution during the current relief rally, as they closely watch Q1FY26 corporate earnings. With valuations running high, an upgrade in earnings is crucial to justify the premium. Meanwhile, global sentiment remains uncertain, weighed down by ongoing tariff concerns, Vinod Nair of Geojit Investments Limited said. However, India’s macroeconomic outlook remains robust, underpinned by a steady decline in inflation, easing interest rates, a favourable monsoon, and cooling oil prices. The market has drawn support from eight consecutive months of falling inflation, boosting investor confidence. At market open on Thursday, July 17, sectoral indices were trading mixed, reflecting a cautious start to the session. The Nifty Pharma index led the gains, rising 0.71 percent, followed by Nifty Realty and Nifty Metal, which were up 0.66 percent and 0.30 percent, respectively. Consumer durables, FMCG, energy, and auto indices also saw mild gains. On the flip side, selling pressure was visible in banking and IT stocks, with Nifty PSU Bank falling 0.44 percent and Nifty IT down 0.23 percent. India VIX remained steady at 11.22, indicating continued low volatility in the market. Among individual stocks, information and technology player Tech Mahindra Ltd (TechM) shares fell by over a percent after the Mahindra Group company posted its earnings results for the three months ended June 30, 2025. Brokerages remained mixed on their outlook for the firm following strong deal wins during the quarter, while the revenue came in under estimates. Emcure Pharmaceuticals rose 2 percent after it signed a deal with Sanofi India to distribute and promote Sanofi’s oral anti-diabetic drugs, including Amaryl and Cetapin, across India. The collaboration aims to expand access to trusted diabetes therapies through Emcure’s strong national network. As for key levels, Nifty is exhibiting early signs of a potential pullback, with persistent buying interest emerging at lower levels, signalling a tug-of-war between bulls and bears. The index has consistently closed above its previous day’s low, indicating a gradual build-up of momentum and the formation of a strong base near the psychologically significant 25,000 level, which also aligns with the 50% Fibonacci retracement, acting as a crucial support. However, the index continues to oscillate below its immediate hurdle at 25,350. Until a breakout occurs, upward moves may remain capped. Hindalco, Sun Pharma, Apollo Hospitals, Adani Enterprises, and Tata Motors were the top gainers on the Nifty. Laggards on the index included Tech Mahindra, ICICI Bank, HDFC Life Insurance, SBI Life Insurance, and Eternal. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Emcure Pharma shares rise 2% on deal to distribute Sanofi India's oral anti-diabetic products
content: Shares of Emcure Pharmaceuticals and Sanofi India rose 2 percent each after the two teamed up deal to widen the reach of Sanofi’s popular oral anti-diabetic (OAD) brands across the country. The partnership, announced on July 16, aims to strengthen access to diabetes care at a time when India faces a growing public health challenge. Under the agreement, Emcure will take over the distribution and promotional responsibilities for Sanofi’s key OAD products—such as Amaryl and Cetapin—while Sanofi will continue to own and manufacture the drugs at its domestic and international sites. The collaboration is already in effect. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates With this move, both companies are looking to combine strengths—Sanofi’s established brands and Emcure’s deep-rooted reach across Indian markets—to serve the more than 100 million Indians living with type 2 diabetes. Importantly, there will be no transfer of employees from Sanofi to Emcure as part of the arrangement. “Over 60 percent of Indians with type 2 diabetes have uncontrolled sugar levels. Through this partnership, we hope to expand the impact of our leading OAD therapies,” said Eric Mansion, General Manager – Pharma, Southeast Asia and India at Sanofi. Also read: Cement, chemicals, consumer discretionary sectors poised for recovery, says Kotak AMC’s Nilesh Shah Emcure MD and CEO Satish Mehta noted that the alliance complements the company’s current diabetes portfolio and marks another step towards improving access to affordable and high-quality treatment. Emcure Pharmaceuticals posted a strong performance for the March quarter of FY25, with consolidated net profit surging 64.4 percent year-on-year to Rs 189 crore, compared to Rs 115 crore in the same quarter last year. The company's revenue also posted a strong growth of 19.5 percent YoY, climbing to Rs 2,116 crore, compared to Rs 1,771.3 crore in Q4FY24, reflecting sustained demand across key markets. At about 9:20 am, shares of the Emcure and Sanofi India were trading at Rs 1,382 and 5,971, higher by 1.5 percent, each. Emcure Pharma shares are down 7 since the beginning of the year, while Sanofi India is up 9 percent in six months. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Mahindra Life final dividend due date tomorrow for Rs 2.8 per share payout; last day to trade today
content: Mahindra Life has announced a final dividend of ₹2.80 per share, with the ex-date due tomorrow, July 18, 2025. This makes today the last day to buy the stock for dividend eligibility, or trade shares before it turns ex-dividend. The company's stock last traded at ₹369.40, marking a 2.54% increase compared to the previous day's closing price. This dividend announcement is likely to be of interest to shareholders, especially in light of the company’s recent financial performance. The dividend payout comes as Mahindra Life navigates through fluctuating financial results. Over the past year, the company has seen varied quarterly performances. In March 2024, the revenue stood at ₹14.29 crore, which then increased significantly to ₹188.14 crore in June 2024. However, revenue decreased to ₹7.61 crore in September 2024 before rebounding to ₹167.28 crore in December 2024. The most recent quarter, ending March 2025, reported revenue of ₹9.24 crore. Net profit figures have also shown considerable volatility. Mahindra Life reported a net loss of ₹7.32 crore in March 2024, which deepened to a loss of ₹23.72 crore in June 2024 and further to a loss of ₹50.39 crore in September 2024. The company managed to reduce its losses to ₹32.43 crore in December 2024 and further to ₹18.07 crore in March 2025. These fluctuations reflect the challenges the company faces in maintaining consistent profitability. Earnings per share (EPS) figures provide additional insight. The EPS was ₹4.62 in March 2024, increased to ₹0.82 in June 2024, but then declined to ₹-0.90 in September 2024 and ₹-1.45 in December 2024. The latest EPS figure for March 2025 stands at ₹5.49, indicating a potential turnaround. Here’s a summary of Mahindra Life’s recent financial performance:Quarterly Financial Performance (in ₹ crore)MetricMar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024Mar 2024Revenue9.24167.287.61188.1414.29Net Profit-18.07-32.43-50.39-23.72-7.32EPS5.49-1.45-0.900.824.62Looking at the yearly financial performance, Mahindra Life’s revenue was ₹372.27 crore for the year ending March 2025, compared to ₹212.09 crore for the year ending March 2024. title: Brokerages mixed on Tech Mahindra following Q1 show, shares fall; should you buy, sell, or hold shares?
content: Information and technology player Tech Mahindra Ltd (TechM) shares fell on Thursday, July 17, after the Mahindra Group company posted its earnings show for the three months ended June 30, 2025. Brokerages remained mixed on their outlook for the firm following strong deal wins during the quarter, while the revenue came in under estimates. Tech Mahindra delivered a strong performance in Q1 FY26, with net profit rising 34 percent year-on-year to Rs 1,141 crore, up from Rs 852 crore a year earlier. The jump in profit came as revenue increased and overall expenses stayed flat. Consolidated revenue grew 3 percent year-on-year to Rs 13,351 crore, while total expenditure edged down slightly to Rs 11,952 crore, aiding margin improvement. However, revenue from the Americas, which contributes nearly half of the company’s total revenue, declined 5.9 percent year-on-year. Net new deal bookings rose to $809 million, up from $798 million in the previous quarter and $534 million in the same period last year. At 9.40 a.m., shares were quoting Rs 1,589.7, down 1.3 percent on the NSE. Should you buy, sell, or hold shares of Tech Mahindra? International brokerage CLSA has an 'outperform' rating with a Rs 2,020 target. The company reported an in-line EBIT, with strong order wins and better margins offsetting slower revenue. CLSA expects growth to pick up from the next quarter, with FY26 revenue likely to surpass FY25. TechM's Q1FY26 is in line with the FY27 strategy, and the management expects above-average growth in FY27, though delays in margin expansion remain a key risk, said HSBC. The brokerage maintained a 'buy' call with a Rs 1,900 target. While the earnings show for the quarter were mixed, the deal wins and pipeline are strong, Nomura noted, expecting better revenue growth in FY26. Nomura has a 'buy' rating on TechM's shares and a Rs 1,810 target price. Jefferies retained an 'underperform' call with a Rs 1,400 target, while Morgan Stanley has an 'underweight' rating with a Rs 1,555 target. The brokerages noted that Q1 revenue missed but profits beat due to higher other income. Order wins were strong, but rich valuations and margin expansion challenges keep its cautious view. The positives for Tech Manhindra are as robust deal wins, stable top clients, and gradual margin improvement. However, concerns remain over weak deal conversion, a challenging manufacturing outlook, and macro headwinds that may impact the balance between growth and margins. Follow our market blog to catch all the live updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Nifty 50 Q1 Results Today: Axis Bank, Wipro, Jio Financial to announce quarterly earnings
content: Several Nifty 50 companies are scheduled to announce their quarterly results on Thursday, July 17, 2025. Axis Bank, Wipro, and Jio Financial are among the companies slated to release their fiscal first quarter results today. Axis Bank Axis Bank is set to announce its quarterly results, and the company's recent financial performance provides a backdrop. Additionally, the bank's board will consider the payment of an interim dividend. Wipro Wipro is also scheduled to announce its quarterly results today. The company held its 79th Annual General Meeting on July 16, 2025. Wipro recently announced an interim dividend of Rs 6.00 per share, with an effective date of January 28, 2025. Recent key financial data for Wipro includes the following: Consolidated Financial Performance (Quarterly)HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 22,208 CroreRs 21,963 CroreRs 22,301 CroreRs 22,318 CroreRs 22,504 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,878 CroreRs 3,041 CroreRs 3,226 CroreRs 3,366 CroreRs 3,559 CroreEPS5.435.756.143.213.41The revenue for Wipro has remained relatively stable over the quarters, with the revenue for the quarter ending March 2025 at Rs 22,504 Crore compared to Rs 22,208 Crore for the quarter ending March 2024. The net profit has shown a steady increase, with a final value of Rs 3,559 Crore for the quarter ending March 2025. Consolidated Financial Performance (Yearly)Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 61,934 CroreRs 79,312 CroreRs 90,487 CroreRs 89,760 CroreRs 89,088 CroreNet ProfitRs 10,855 CroreRs 12,237 CroreRs 11,372 CroreRs 11,135 CroreRs 13,192 CroreEPS19.1122.3720.7320.8912.56BVPS100.48119.40141.63142.6578.65ROE19.6618.6914.6114.8115.94Debt to Equity0.120.230.190.190.20The yearly data shows fluctuations in revenue and net profit. The revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 89,088 Crore. Net profit increased from Rs 10,855 Crore in 2021 to Rs 13,192 Crore in 2025. Jio Financial Jio Financial Services Ltd is also set to announce its quarterly results. The board meeting is scheduled for July 17, 2025, to consider and approve the unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. A presentation to analysts on the financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, will be made on July 17, 2025, after the board meeting. The trading window close period commenced from July 1, 2025. The yearly data shows significant growth in revenue and net profit from 2023 to 2024. The revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 2,042.91 Crore compared to Rs 41.63 Crore in 2023. Net profit increased from Rs 31.25 Crore in 2023 to Rs 1,219.77 Crore in 2025. The announcements from these Nifty 50 companies are expected to provide insights into their financial health and strategic direction.

title: Patanjali Foods stock jumps 6.6% on Wednesday, top gainer on Nifty Midcap 150

title: PB Fintech-Policybazaar shares fall 2.57% on Wednesday, among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of PB Fintech (Policybazaar) ended down 2.57% at Rs 1,812.50 on Wednesday, making it among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 in yesterday's session. The stock's performance reflected negative investor sentiment. PB Fintech's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 1,507.87 Crore, compared to Rs 1,089.57 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending March 2025 was Rs 170.88 Crore, significantly higher than the Rs 60.66 Crore reported in March 2024. The company's EPS for the quarter-ending March 2025 was Rs 3.73, up from Rs 1.35 in March 2024. Another interim dividend of Rs 1.50 per share (15%) was announced on February 6, 2024, with an effective date of February 16, 2024. Moneycontrol analysis on July 11, 2025, indicated a bearish sentiment for the stock. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 238.40, NLC India has seen a positive movement, positioning it among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index at yesterday's close.

title: M&M stock rises 2.17% yesterday, among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of M&M were among the stocks that led gains on the Nifty 50 in yesterday's trading, rising 2.17% to end at Rs 3,196.50. This performance positioned M&M as one of the top gainers on the benchmark index at Wednesday's close. The company's financial performance shows consistent growth. Consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 42,599.31 Crore, compared to Rs 35,451.73 Crore in March 2024. Net profit for the same quarter was Rs 3,102.48 Crore, compared to Rs 2,730.21 Crore in the corresponding period last year. The EPS for March 2025 was Rs 29.52, up from Rs 24.71 in March 2024. title: GIFT Nifty indicates a positive start for Sensex, Nifty; key levels to track on July 17
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex are likely to open higher on July 17, buoyed by firm global cues after Wall Street closed in the green. Market mood got a slight lift after Donald Trump ruled out firing US Fed Chair Jerome Powell and hinted at a potential trade deal with India. However, persistent concerns over Q1 earnings and tariff-related uncertainties continue to weigh on investor sentiment. Around 7:40 am, GIFT Nifty was up 0.2 percent at 25,280. Dalal Street saw a choppy session yesterday as Nifty 50 and Sensex recovered from the day's low by the afternoon session of trade, but a lack of buying failed to keep the indices solidly above the flatline. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates On July 16, Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) were net sellers to the tune of Rs 1858 crore worth of shares in Indian equities, while domestic institutional investors (DIIs) net bought Rs 1224 crore worth of shares, according to provisional NSE data. Here are the important levels to watch out for in today's session Nifty index is exhibiting early signs of a potential pullback, with persistent buying interest emerging at lower levels, signalling a tug-of-war between bulls and bears. The index has consistently closed above its previous day’s low, indicating a gradual build-up of momentum and the formation of a strong base near the psychologically significant 25,000 level, which also aligns with the 50% Fibonacci retracement, acting as a crucial support. However, the index continues to oscillate below its immediate hurdle at 25,350. Until a breakout occurs, upward moves may remain capped. "Nifty Bank index is hinting at a resurgence in bullish sentiment, supported by consistent buying activity from lower levels, with dips being actively absorbed, highlighting underlying strength," Dhupesh Dhameja of SAMCO Securities said. "Encouragingly, the index continues to sustain above its 10-day and 20-day EMAs, both of which are upward sloping, providing cushion at lower zones and reinforcing the bullish undertone. The 57,350–57,400 range has now become a key resistance pocket or supply zone. A clean breakout above 57,350 is essential to signal trend continuation on the upside," he added. India VIX declined further by 2.1 percent to settle at 11.24, continuing to hover well below the critical 15-mark. This prolonged low-volatility phase signals that while sellers remain active at higher levels, there is no sense of panic in the market. The muted VIX suggests a controlled consolidation rather than a fear-driven selloff, highlighting a lack of directional conviction. The Put-Call Ratio (PCR) has improved slightly to 0.80 from 0.75, reflecting an uptick in put writing. However, the relatively low PCR still underline a bearish undertone in the market. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
content: Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty are likely to open on a positive note today, tracking cues from GIFT Nifty trading around 25,270 a short while ago this morning. Track the latest updates on GIFT Nifty right here on Moneycontrol. Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex ended flat after a rangebound day on July 16, helped by gains in auto, financials, IT and realty stocks, as the 50-share index recovered from the day's low of 25,121 to close above 25,200. At closing bell, the Sensex was up 63.57 points or 0.08 percent at 82,634.48, and the Nifty was up 16.25 points or 0.06 percent at 25,212.05. Broader market indices performed in-line with the main indices, as Nifty Mid and Smallcap ended flat. Here is how financial markets across the globe fared overnight: GIFT Nifty (Up) The GIFT Nifty is trading higher at around 25,270, indicating a positive start for the day. Asian Equities (Mixed) Asian stocks struggled for direction at the open after US markets had a volatile session amid speculation about the future of Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell.  US Equities (Gain) Wall Street benchmarks closed modestly higher on Wednesday, with the Nasdaq Composite achieving its latest record finish, despite a chaotic half hour when news reports suggested U.S. President Donald Trump was set to fire Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell. Shortly before midday, the benchmark S&P 500 and Nasdaq fell more than 1%, while the dollar plunged and Treasury yields rose, after Bloomberg News reported the possibility of replacing Powell, citing an unidentified White House official. Trump's denial revived equity markets, with the Nasdaq Composite closing at 20,730.49, a gain of 52.69 points, or 0.26%. It was the fifth session in six that the technology-heavy index has posted a record high. The Dow Jones Industrial Average tab rose 231.49 points, or 0.53%, to 44,254.78, and the S&P 500 gained 19.94 points, or 0.32%, at 6,263.70.  US Bond Yield (Up) The yield on 10-year Treasuries and 2-year Treasuries was up marginally at 4.47% and 3.9%, respectively, in the early trade on THursday.  Dollar Index (Flat) The dollar was on a fragile footing on Thursday having lost ground overnight as concerns U.S. President Donald Trump was preparing to fire the Federal Reserve chair shook confidence in U.S. markets.  Asian currencies (Down) Asian currencies were trading mostly lower in the early Thursday trade, with Thai Baht leading the losers followed by Indonesian Rupiah, South Korean Won, Japanese Yen, Malaysian Ringgit, Singapore Dollar, Taiwan Dollar.  Crude (Rises) Oil prices rose in early trade on Thursday, reversing the previous session's losses, buoyed by stronger-than-expected economic data from the world’s top oil consumers and signs of easing trade tensions.  Gold (Gains) Gold steadied after a volatile session on Wednesday as traders assessed the outlook for Jerome Powell’s tenure as Federal Reserve chair after more speculation that President Donald Trump may ax him.  Fund Flow Action The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) sold equities worth Rs 1,858 crore on July 16. On the other hand, Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) continued their buying on 8th day as they purchased equities worth Rs 1,223 crore on the same day.  Hope you're all set for today's trade. We wish you a profitable day ahead. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Stocks to Watch Today: Tech Mahindra, Angel One, Ixigo, Maruti Suzuki, Godrej Properties, Hindustan Zinc, Zydus Life, Smartworks in focus on 17 July
content: Let's catch up on the latest news from the stock market. From significant investments to major deals, quarterly earnings, fund raising and acquisitions, here’s a quick look at which stocks will be in focus in today's trade: Results Today Axis Bank, Wipro, Jio Financial Services, LTIMindtree, HDFC Asset Management Company, 360 ONE WAM, Alok Industries, Ceat, Clean Science and Technology, Indian Hotels Company, Nuvoco Vistas Corporation, Polycab India, Shoppers Stop, South Indian Bank, Sunteck Realty, Sterling and Wilson Renewable Energy, Tata Communications, and Waaree Renewable Technologies will release their quarterly earnings scorecard on July 17. Quarterly Earnings Tech Mahindra Q1 (Consolidated YoY) Profit zooms 34% to Rs 1,140.6 crore Vs Rs 851.5 crore Revenue grows 2.7% to Rs 13,351.2 crore Vs Rs 13,005.5 crore EBIT soars 34% to Rs 1,477.1 crore Vs Rs 1,102.3 crore Margin expands to 11.06% Vs 8.47% Other income jumps 50.9% to Rs 218.3 crore Vs Rs 144.7 crore Dollar revenue rises 0.3% to $1,564 million Vs $1,559 million New deal wins at $809 million Vs $534 million Angel One Q1 (Consolidated YoY) Profit tanks 61% to Rs 114.5 crore Vs Rs 292.7 crore Revenue declines 18.8% to Rs 1,140.5 crore Vs Rs 1,405.5 crore L&T Technology Services Q1 (Consolidated YoY) Profit rises 0.7% to Rs 315.7 crore Vs Rs 313.6 crore Revenue grows 16.4% to Rs 2,866 crore Vs Rs 2,461.9 crore EBIT falls 0.6% to Rs 381.3 crore Vs Rs 383.6 crore Margin declines to 13.3% Vs 15.6% Dollar revenue soars 13.6% to $335.3 million Vs $295.2 million Company expects to clock double-digit growth in FY26 Le Travenues Technology-Ixigo Q1 (Consolidated YoY) Profit zooms 27.5% to Rs 18.9 crore Vs Rs 14.9 crore Revenue surges 72.9% to Rs 314.5 crore Vs Rs 181.9 crore Business Update (June YoY) GMR Airports Passenger traffic grows 0.9% to 97.93 lakh Domestic passenger traffic increases 2.9% International passenger traffic jumps 4.6% Aircraft movements rise 2.6% to 61,251 Stocks to Watch Maruti Suzuki India The company has announced the standardization of six airbags in the Ertiga and Baleno. This will result in an average ex-showroom price increase of 1.4% for the Ertiga and 0.5% for the Baleno, effective July 16. State Bank of India The Board of Directors of the bank has approved the launch of a Qualified Institutional Placement (QIP) issuance on July 16, with the floor price set at Rs 811.05 per share. This floor price is lower than the closing price of Rs 831.55 per share on Wednesday. Godrej Properties The real estate developer has announced its entry into Raipur through the acquisition of 50 acres of land. Development on this land will primarily consist of premium plotted residential units, offering an estimated saleable area of 9.5 lakh square feet. Hindustan Zinc The Ministry of Mines has issued a Letter of Intent to Hindustan Zinc, naming it the preferred bidder for the grant of a composite license through the e-auction of the Jhandawali–Satipura Amalgamated Potash and Halite block in Rajasthan. The block covers an extent of 1,841.25 hectares in the Hanumangarh district. Zydus Lifesciences The US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) conducted a Remote Regulatory Assessment (RRA) at Zydus’ formulations manufacturing facility in Matoda, Gujarat, for the Prior Approval Supplement (PAS) of Atorvastatin Calcium Tablets USP (10 mg, 20 mg, 40 mg, and 80 mg). At closure, no observations were noted, and the site was recommended for approval. Emcure Pharmaceuticals Emcure has entered into an exclusive distribution and promotion agreement with Sanofi India for Sanofi’s oral anti-diabetic (OAD) drugs, including Amaryl and Cetapin, in India. The agreement is effective immediately. JSW Hydro Energy (subsidiary of JSW Energy) The Supreme Court has upheld Himachal Pradesh’s right to receive 18% of power free of cost generated by JSW Hydro Energy, as per the agreement. A bench comprising Justices P S Narasimha and Joymalya Bagchi set aside the Himachal Pradesh High Court's earlier ruling, which had reduced the free power supply to 13%. JSW Hydro Energy operates a 1,045 MW hydroelectric project at Karcham Wangtoo, Himachal Pradesh. title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade Tata Power, SBI, Punjab National Bank, LIC Housing Finance, M&M, Edelweiss Financial and others on July 17?
content: Indian equity benchmarks closed with moderate gains on July 16, continuing their uptrend for another session with positive market breadth. A total of 1,513 shares saw buying interest compared to 1,144 shares that were under bear control on the NSE. The upward journey amid rangebound trading is expected to continue if the market defends the previous day's low. Below are some short-term trading ideas to consider: Jatin Gedia, Technical Research Analyst at Mirae Asset Sharekhan Tata Power Company | CMP: Rs 414.7  Tata Power Company has broken out of a Bullish Flag pattern on the daily charts. The breakout has been accompanied by above-average volume. The daily momentum indicator has triggered a positive crossover from the equilibrium line, which is a buy signal.
